content:
@oli (not sure who else is paying attention to the tracking issue, feel free to ping others)

I am thinking that it might make sense for us to take git subtree and either build our own gits or if it's a shell script basically to pull it into a rust-lang repository and move forward. It seems like it should be possible to make a cargo install git-subtree that installs either a Rust wrapper around the shell script or something like that, and that would unblock a bunch of work around it
Does this seem like a horrible idea?
The script seems to be written to work with older git versions. For example it has a if test "$version" \< "git version 1.7" conditional.

@oli do you think you can either post to the issue tracking this or figure out who all to talk to so we can make this happen? I am happy to help on the "infra" side if you need repositories created or what not
What is the tracking issue for this?
I'll do a post tomorrow. https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/issues/5565 is the issue on the clippy side
@Camelid the rustc issue is https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/70651
